Documentary (04:37) Documentary at Tisch provides students with an opportunity to learn how to make compelling short documentary projects in which real people are the characters and real life is the plot.  Experimental Filmmaking (05:17) Experimental Production Workshop at Tisch encourages students to experiment with media content, structure, style and unconventional narrative format. It is a forum for the exchange and developmental design of innovative ideas and attitudes towards personal filmmaking.  Writing at Film and TV (05:51) At the heart of filmmaking, is storytelling. This has always been and continues to be the department's fundamental principle. To that end, UGFTV asks all of its students to learn the basics of dramatic theory and narrative storytelling. Comedy Writing: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Comedy Writing for Film and Television  FMTV-UT.1158 Studio 4 Credits Course Level: Advanced (formerly Advanced Comedy Writing Workshop)      Prerequisite: Fundamentals of Dramatic and Visual Writing (H56.0033), or Dramatic & Visual Writing II (H56.0032), or Script Writing II (H56.0056). Starting Spring 2010, this course will require Writing the Short Screenplay (H56.1020) or Script Analysis (H56.1084). Course may be repeated.    In this course you will have the opportunity to write: comedy feature film, half-hour sitcom specs scripts, series of comedy sketches and stand-up comedy material. This intimate class is a writing workshop that explores every aspect of comedy writing for visual media. Whether it’s Larry David that does it for you, or the Brothers Farrelly, Marx or Coen, this course will help students discover what works, what doesn’t, and why. The last part of the semester will be devoted to the business of comedy writing – where the work is, who the players are. Industry guest speakers may visit throughout the semester.
